column3:
Before (focus on left bottom status bar):
![bildschirmfoto 2015-01-09 um 11 03 46](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/178464/5678929/23697eba-97f8-11e4-8de6-4c5c5e9cc2e4.png)
![bildschirmfoto 2015-01-09 um 11 58 56](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/178464/5678935/29f04e44-97f8-11e4-9aac-ecb2da723703.png)

After:
![bildschirmfoto 2015-01-09 um 12 07 21](https://cloud.githubus
Just to mention it, Thunderbird on Windows has it, Firefox or IE don't... not sure about this one. I tend to don't care ;).\n
Prefer to keep it (it's not hurting anything), but don't care.\n

@luke-jr: I know. It's minimal.
But have a look at the screenshot/mockup below.
I really care about margins and paddings.
The right unused margin in the status bar always poked me.

![github](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/178464/5717386/432f6498-9b00-11e4-836c-937a3830f744.png)
Seems a bit like the UI equivalent of premature optimization. Isn't the point of a size grip to communicate that the window can be resized?\n

@laanwj: Right. But the grip is only visible on windows. On Linux and Mac there is a unused space to the right.

On window there are many apps where the grip is not visible but the window is also resizable.

See also:
Internet Explorer, Filer-Explorer, Terminal: nowadays most apps/windows don't have a resize handle.

![bildschirmfoto 2015-01-20 um 16 18 29](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/178464/5819693/0128eb1c-a0c0-11e4-827c-00e143a3c9a9.png)
